goldenArtifacts.summary: Keeps generated assets like Launcher/logs, node_modules, dist, and Rust targets out of version control.
Declares the vendor/WeylandTavern submodule sourced from the upstream nightly branch (shallow clone).
Local pre-commit hook preventing accidental commits that change the submodule HEAD.
Runtime defaults for vendor paths, server host/port, npm install policy, character sync toggle, and update script path.
Setup guide covering prerequisites, environment variables, and npm/tauri commands.
Vite HTML entry shell that loads src/main.tsx into #root.
NPM manifest declaring scripts and dependencies for the launcher UI and tauri tooling.
Pins Rust dependencies for deterministic tauri backend builds.
Defines the tauri backend crate, dependencies, and Windows-specific features.
Invokes tauri_build so Tauri generates bindings/resources during compilation.
Application icon bundled with the desktop app.
Async Tauri commands handling git updates, npm installs, process supervision, logging, and health checks.
Tauri application configuration including window dimensions, CSP, and build hooks.
React component orchestrating the update prompts, character sync, log overlay, and iframe handoff.
React entry point bootstrapping the App component.
TypeScript compiler settings targeting ES2020 modules with React JSX and Tauri API types.
Vite configuration enabling the React plugin and keeping console output intact.
Windows batch wrapper that runs the PowerShell updater with origin/nightly and PinExact flags.
PowerShell script that fetches/checks out the requested vendor ref and commits the submodule pointer when it changes.
Git submodule containing the SillyTavern payload expected by the launcher.
